message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.CL. 

The paper proposes a novel approach for meta-learning that addresses issues of catastrophic forgetting and insufficient robustness, which are common problems in machine learning. The approach involves continual learning of a sequence of tasks represented as graphs, with intra- and inter-task correlations preserved via message-passing and history transition. The use of Bayesian Graph Neural Networks and Bayes by Backprop strategy further enhances the model's performance. Given these factors, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.CV (Computer Vision), cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
